Race.SpecificTitle: Justice of the Peace -- Justice of the Peace District  4
Constable -- Justice of the Peace District  2
Waterworks Dist.#2(Prop1) -- Prop.#1 - 11.80 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
 (Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10 year 11.80 mills property tax continuation for constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating facilities and equipment of and for the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. 2 of the Parish of Beauregard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy an eleven and eighty hundredths (11.80) mills tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $148,362) on all property subject to taxation in said District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating facilities and equipment of and for the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks Dist.#2(Prop2) -- Prop.#2 - $1,200,000 Bond - BOC - 20 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Bonds)

Summary:  Authority to issue $1,200,000 of 20 year general obligation bonds for constructing and acquiring extensions and improvements to the waterworks plant and system of the District, title to which shall be in the public, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. 2 of the Parish of Beauregard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of One Million Two Hundred Thousand Dollars ($1,200,000), to run twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing and acquiring extensions and improvements to the waterworks plant and system of the District, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
